definition: to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for

sentences.english: The factory has not formulated the policy which prohibit form cliques for private gain.
sentences.chinese: 工廠沒有制定書面的禁止結黨營私的政策。

definition: to accumulate/to gather/to amass wealth by heavy taxation or other unscrupulous means/(science) convergent
to appoint people by favoritism (idiom); nepotism/corrupt appointment
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
toadying for personal gain/to curry favor/to study in great depth
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
lit. to kill the chicken to get the eggs (idiom)/fig. to kill the goose that lays the golden eggs
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
